law.catch_line: Promotion of milk production and use in public interest.
law.text: It is declared to be in the interest of the public welfare that Kentucky farmers who are producers of milk and milk products, shall be permitted and encouraged to act jointly and in cooperation with all producers, handlers, dealers and processors of such products in promoting and stimulating, by advertising, research and other methods, the increased production, use and sale, domestic and foreign, of any and all of such agricultural commodities.

metadata.former-history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 42c-32.
metadata.note: Former KRS 247.450, "Expenses of commission; moneys from source other than state", was recodified from 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942 from Ky. Stat. sec. 42c-32. -- This section was considered obsolete and was omitted from the 1948 edition of the KRS and subsequent editions.
